intro: Paeonia officinalis subsp. broteri, commonly known as the Moroccan peony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to deep pink, typically blooming in late spring. The plant has palmate leaves composed of 5–7 lobes, and its stems are usually hairy and somewhat woody. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental beauty and historical use in traditional medicine.
